name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Great Ideas in Practical Games Development
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Great Ideas in Practical Games Development
long_desc: This course intends to give a solid understanding into the process of art creation and programming involved in game development. This class is intended for both beginners and experienced game designers. In addition to project work done in class, students will learn fundamental tools like Unreal, Autodesk Maya, Substance Painter, and Photoshop. Additionally, they will learn to use source control and work as a team. Students will complete a game project under guidance, and gain insight into the steps involved in creating a game. There will be weekly lectures, intermittent optional and guest lectures. Well use a Discord server as our primary means of communication. Prior experience is not needed

custom_fields.goals: Students will know how to use tools such as Unreal Engine, Autodesk Maya, Substance Painter and Github
custom_fields.key_topics: Learn basic tools of game development and 3D art creation.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
¿ Learn the basic tools of game development.
¿ Learn the software used to create 3D art and animation.
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
Attendance is 20%
Weekly assignments is 60%
Midterm is 10%
Final is 10%
custom_fields.relevance:
Do you want to...
-Make cool models in Maya?
-Learn to rig and animate?
-Make things look shiny/menacing/bagel-like?
OR perhaps you want to...
-Learn Unreal Engine?
-Make an AWESOME SHOOTER?
-Make food go splat?
If the answer to any of those questions is YES, then this is the StuCo for you!
We will be making a First Person Shooter called Food Fight!
custom_fields.learning_resources: Guides and video tutorials on Canvas, Discord and Google Drive.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: There are going to be homework assignments given out after most classes to either do programming (if student is a programmer) or art (if student is an artist) related tasks.
